intro: Porophyllum linarifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white petals. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Porophyllum linarifolium is often found in the western United States and is adapted to arid environments.
